member.name: T:EntLibContrib.Common.SerializationUtility
member.summary: Utility class for serializing and deserializing objects to and from byte streams
member.remarks: This utility has been lifted from the Caching block in order to remove the direct dependancy on the caching block. Although this goes against best practise it enables providers to maintain independence from the other blocks as much as possible. Hopefully one day the MS patterns team will put this utility into Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Common

member.name: M:EntLibContrib.Common.SerializationUtility.ToBytes(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts an object into an array of bytes. Object must be serializable.
member.param: Object to serialize. May be null.
member.returns: Serialized object, or null if input was null.

member.name: M:EntLibContrib.Common.SerializationUtility.ToObject(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Converts a byte array into an object.
member.param: Object to deserialize. May be null.
member.returns: Deserialized object, or null if input was null.

member.name: F:EntLibContrib.Common.Configuration.CommonSettings.AssemblyExtension
member.summary: manifest extension for all embedded resources.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:EntLibContrib.Common.INullableReader
member.summary: This interface defines the contract that a class must implement to read both non-null and nullable data. Use this interface polymorphically rather than the direct implementations, that way it does not matter how data is read you can use a single nullable reader method to deal with null values.
member.remarks: This modified version of the code project article by Steve Michelotti, makes use of the keyword for generic types rather than returning null values. Original article webLink: http://www.codeproject.com/KB/database/NullableReaders.aspx

member.summary: Gets the column name at the ordinal position.

member.name: M:EntLibContrib.Common.INullableReader.GetOrdinal(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the ordinal position of the column name.

member.summary: Gets a data value with conversion to the given type.

member.summary: Gets a data value with conversion to the given type.

member.summary: Gets the type information for the column.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified name is valid field.
member.returns: true if the specified name is a field; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Determines whether the value of the named column is equal to DBNull.

member.name: T:EntLibContrib.Common.INullableWriter`1
member.summary: This interface defines the contract that a class must implement to write both non-null and nullable data. Use this interface polymorphically rather than the direct implementations, that way it does not matter how data is written you can use a single nullable writer method to deal with null values.

member.name: T:EntLibContrib.Common.Configuration.TypeConfigurationElement`1
member.summary: Defines a Polymorphic Configuration Element without having to be part of a PolymorphicConfigurationElementCollection. Works similar to what XmlSerializer does with xsi:type attribute.
member.remarks: The type attribute has to be the first one. If not specified, it is assumed the elements is of type T. Implementation relies on private reflection as many methods are private on ConfigurationElement.

member.name: M:EntLibContrib.Common.Configuration.TypeConfigurationElement`1.IsModified
member.summary: Indicates whether this configuration element has been modified since it was last saved or loaded, when implemented in a derived class.
member.returns: true if the element has been modified; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:EntLibContrib.Common.Configuration.TypeConfigurationElement`1.Deserialize(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Deserializes the Element from the content of the reader.

member.name: M:EntLibContrib.Common.Configuration.TypeConfigurationElement`1.CreateElement
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the Element.

member.name: M:EntLibContrib.Common.Configuration.TypeConfigurationElement`1.Unmerge(System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement,System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement,System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode)
member.summary: Modifies the object to remove all values that should not be saved.
member.param: A at the current level containing a merged view of the properties.
The parent , or null if this is the top level.
A that determines which property values to include.

member.name: M:EntLibContrib.Common.Configuration.TypeConfigurationElement`1.SerializeElement(System.Xml.XmlWriter,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the contents of this configuration element to the configuration file when implemented in a derived class.
member.param: The that writes to the configuration file.
true to serialize only the collection key properties; otherwise, false.
member.returns: true if any data was actually serialized; otherwise, false.
member.exception: The current attribute is locked at a higher configuration level.

member.name: M:EntLibContrib.Common.Configuration.TypeConfigurationElement`1.DeserializeElement(System.Xml.XmlReader,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads XML from the configuration file.
member.param: The that reads from the configuration file.
true to serialize only the collection key properties; otherwise, false.
member.exception: The element to read is locked. - or - An attribute of the current node is not recognized. - or - The lock status of the current node cannot be determined.

member.name: P:EntLibContrib.Common.Configuration.TypeConfigurationElement`1.Element
member.summary: The Element itself within the TypeConfigurationElement container.

member.summary: Type used to create the Element during Deserialization.

member.summary: Gets the name of the element type.
member.value: The name of the element type.
